column9: What do you like about this workshop? What strategies do you want to use immediately in your next workshop?
column10: What can be improved about the workshop?
column11: Can we use your testimonial for social media purposes to promote our workshops to others?
column12: Can we use printscreens from this workshop (that could include your image) in our social media to share about our workshops to others?

column9: The ideas were explained with direct exaples, and that was helpful. The parking lot, the KWL and 321 are ideas i will be using.
column10: The speed was too brisk to stay on time, we may ease that up a bit.

column9: Variety of tools: mural, polls, break out sessions, temperature check

column10: it is very difficult to follow this workshop as a non native speaker and not being totally used to the different plattforms also the pace is very quick

column9: The strategies you introduced were all very helpful and directly applicable, and gives us a 'bank' of ideas to sort of have in our back pockets for future workshops. The strategies I would use immediately are the note taking strategies, parking lot, the golden circle, do-now, CFU, and the "think about a time when"...part
column10: It would have been good to have a clearly link between the andragogy principles and how the strategies reflect these principles e.g. I can understand why CFU is helpful but struggle to see the immediate link to the 4 principles - feel the new ideas today were somehow missing an anchor that I could sort of keep going back to to consolidate my understanding (or maybe the anchor ideas did not sink in in time!). To use your analogy, I did not really feel the scaffolding building up properly for me, but felt more like trying different types of ladders to get to the roof!

column9: The different strategies that can be used to keep a session engaging
column10: How to use interactive methods for theoretical workshops

column9: Use of visuals and style of presentation by the facilitators - pausing to ask for feedback etc. very useful tips and techniques
column10: presenting/ speaking at a slower pace
